name: Universidad Nacional Experimental del Táchira
description:
La Universidad Nacional Experimental del Tachira was created by decree of the Presidency of the Republic No. 1630, dated February 27, 1974, with targets on regional development specified in its General Rules. Among the founders are professors Bastos Nieto, Lorenzo Marquez and Guillermo Monroy. 

The Integral Development Plan presented by the University to the then Ministry of Education and the National Council of Universities foresees the creation of a university that functions through integrated teaching, research and outreach, influences the formation of human resources, bound by knowledge of context to solving the problems of the region and the country. 

The university started its academic activities in June 23, 1975 on a project which initially runs in Agro Sciences and Engineering Industry. Agro Sciences began with Agricultural Engineering and Animal Husbandry (now Animal Production Engineering) and in the Engineering Industry with Industrial Engineering to which was added after Mechanical Engineering. In 1983, establishing a career in Architecture. In 1986, thanks to an agreement between the University of Zulia and UNET, start postgraduate activities. In 1991 began the program activities of Electronic Engineering in 1997 in Computer Engineering and Environmental Engineering in 2004. 

In 2006 opened the first career of humanistic University, Bachelor of Music, followed by six projects opening short technical courses in partnership with several universities in the country.
